entry.title: Celtic’s Summer Exit Tally Reaches 12
entry.summary: Celtic have been clearing the deck for the next stage of Ange Postecoglou’s Parkhead tenure. We now count TWELVE players who have move out of the club this summer with only three loans among them. It was always going to be the case there would be more outgoings than incomings after the upheaval the summer […] Source

entry.title: BYE BYE BLUNDER BHOY BOLI
entry.summary: BLUNDER Bhoy Boli Bolingoli has left Celtic on a permanent deal to return to Belgium with Mechelen. The frozen-out left-back, who made only two first-team appearances for Ange Postecoglou, has gone after playing only 31 games since his £3million arrival from Austrian outfit Rapid Vienna in the summer of 2019, according to a report on [...]

entry.title: Boli Bolingoli speaks after permanent Celtic exit; Mechelen explain signing to fans
entry.summary: Boli Bolingoli has signed for Belgian top-flight side KV Mechelen on a two-year contract, ending his spell at Celtic for good. Bolingoli was signed by Neil Lennon in 2019 but was rarely convincing and ultimately fell foul of the club’s Covid-19 restrictions in 2020. entry.title: Confirmed: Boli Bolingoli Permanent Celtic Exit
entry.summary: Boli Bolingoli has finally left Celtic on a permanent basis. The club announced on Tuesday afternoon the defender has moved to Belgian side Mechelen. entry.title: In Spite Of The Headlines, Celtic Never Confirmed Any Interest In Fausto Vera.
entry.summary: Since the story about our “interest” in Fausto Vera broke, I have been waiting on two things; a confirmed bid from Celtic, or someone at Celtic confirming that we were ready to make one. entry.title: Banik Ostrava go all out with plans for Celtic visit

entry.title: Kyogo is even a step ahead of Celtic teammates says David Turnbull, as he relishes link-up with striker next season
entry.summary: THE movement of Kyogo has left many a defender dizzy since he burst onto the scene at Celtic last season, but his speed is such that it is often difficult even for his own teammates to keep up with him.

entry.title: Matt O’Riley aiming to cap off Celtic rise with World Cup place – with a little help from Morten Wieghorst
entry.summary: WITH the greatest of respect to MK Dons, the rise of their former captain Matt O’Riley has been a remarkable one over the past six months or so. Not only has the young midfielder become an integral member of the Celtic squad, but he may well find himself at the World Cup come the end of the year.
